alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 4:22PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT COCONINO COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM MST... At 421 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Paria Canyon to near Vermilion Cliffs N.M. to near Sand Hill Petroglyphs to Jacob Lake. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marble Canyon, Jacob Lake, Paria Canyon, Cliff Dwellers, House Rock, Cathedral Wash Trailhead, Lee`s Ferry, Jackass Canyon, House Rock Overlook, Vermilion Cliffs N.M., Lees Ferry, and Paria Beach. This includes the following highways... State Route 67 between mile markers 580 and 598. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 522 and 537, and between mile markers 555 and 556. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 524 and 571, and between mile markers 573 and 580. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Black Mesa Area; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
